https://www.ted.com/talks/katieboumanwhatdoesablackholelooklike/transcript?language=en#t-432870

Katie Bouman: How to take a picture of a black hole

0:12

"In the movie 'Interstellar,' we get an up-close look at a supermassive black hole. Set against a backdrop of bright gas, the black hole's massive gravitational pull bends light into a ring. However, this isn't a real photograph, but a computer graphic rendering â€” an artistic interpretation of what a black hole might look like."

0:31

"A hundred years ago, Albert Einstein first published his theory of general relativity. In the years since then, scientists have provided a lot of evidence in support of it. But one thing predicted from this theory, black holes, still have not been directly observed ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - How to Take a Picture of a Black Hole - Part 01
